llm.feedback:
Your draft meets the 4‑line up/down requirement but needs tighter formatting and clearer “What to watch” signals. Replace each line with the exact format:  
**Up/Down | Time window | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %**.  
For example:  
`Up | 0‑3 weeks | Favorable court ruling (LJZYDXVL3) | Court decision outcome | 55%`  
`Up | 0‑3 weeks | Fed rate cut (MEZ3P47LC) | Fed announcement on 25‑bp cut | 30%`  
`Down | 0‑3 weeks | Unfavorable court ruling (LJZYDXVL3) | Court decision outcome | 45%`  
`Down | 0‑3 weeks | Fed tightening/higher yields (MEZ3P47LC) | Fed announcement or 10‑yr yield rise | 25%`  

The trade line must follow the Swing‑Trade template:  
`Direction | Horizon | Entry | Stop | Target | R/R | Invalidation | Trigger | Probability % | Confidence`.  
Use TSLA’s current price (≈$346) as a reference:  
`Up | 0‑3 weeks | 330 | 320 | 360 | 1.2 | Unfavorable court ruling (LJZYDXVL3) or Fed tightening (MEZ3P47LC) | Favorable court ruling (LJZYDXVL3) or Fed rate cut (MEZ3P47LC) | 85% | 80`.  

Ensure every probability is grounded in the cited evidence (e.g., 55 % from the court‑ruling likelihood, 30 % from FedWatch). Remove any extraneous fields or filler, keep citations inline only when stating specific facts, and avoid a trailing reference list. This will satisfy the format, provide actionable signals, and align with the canonical handle TSLA.
